title: Bulgarian PM tells head of football to quit over racist abuse of England players
text:
Home fans made monkey chants and Nazi salutes during the match (Picture: Rex Features)

Bulgaria’s prime minister has called for the country’s head of football to step down over the racist abuse which marred their Euro 2020 qualifier against England.

The Three Lions’ 6-0 win was overshadowed by monkey chants and Nazi salutes aimed at black players and coaching staff by sections of home fans.

Sanctions from European football’s governing body UEFA seem sure to follow, and Bulgarian leader Boyko Borissov is now reported to have told the president of the Bulgarian Football Union, Borislav Mihaylov, to resign.

‘I strongly condemn the conduct of some of the fans at the stadium #BULENG,’ he wrote.

‘It is unacceptable that Bulgaria, which is one of the most tolerant states in the world and where people of different ethnic and religious background peacefully live together, should be associated with racism.’

The gestures mostly came from a pocket of black-clad home supporters (Picture: Getty Images)

England players and manager Gareth Southgate speak to referee Ivan Bebek as the match is halted during the first half (Picture: Action Images via Reuters)

England’s Marcus Rashford with manager Gareth Southgate after being substituted off (Picture: Action Images via Reuters)

Earlier Sports Minister Krasen Kralev said the government would suspend relations with the Bulgarian Football Union (BFU), including financial ties.

‘The prime minister called me urgently a short time ago,’ he told reporters.

‘The government has done a lot for the development of Bulgarian football in the last four years.

‘But after the recent events, having in mind the whole state of football and last night’s incidents, the prime minister has ordered me from today to suspend any relations with the BFU, including financial ones, until the resignation of Borislav Mihaylov.’

The BFU sought to play down the incident after the game, with vice-president Yordan Lechkov telling reporters it was ‘quite disappointing to focus on racism’.

Coach Krasimir Balakov instead pointed the finger at England fans for being disrespectful to Bulgarian supporters.

Speaking afterwards he said he ‘didn’t actually hear anything’ and was only told of the abuse after talking to reporters.

‘I told them that if this is proven to be true, then we have to be ashamed and we have to apologise for it,’ he added.

‘But, once again, first it has to be proven to be true.’

UEFA is expected to receive the referee’s report on Tuesday, and it will then be for its control, ethics and disciplinary body to open an investigation.

description: England's 6-0 Euro 2020 qualifier win was overshadowed by monkey chants and Nazi salutes aimed at black players and coaching staff.
